title: Funerary inscription for (?)Marcus Flavius Tuendus
support: No description of the stone is preserved

layout.p: The text is recorded in the antiquarian tradition over 6 lines

handNote.lettering: No description exists, but Castelli 1784 transcribes with lunate sigma and mostly lunate epsilon

provenanceFound._: Dug up in 1771 in the ruins of ancient Halaesa; recorded in 1784 as preserved at Monteregale (= Monreale?), ‘in monasterio Canonicorum regularium Benedictinae familiae’.

provenanceObserved._: At time of Castelli (1784) in Monteregale, in Monastery Canonicorum Regularium Benedictinae Familiae

graphics.desc: Copy of Castelli 1784, 192 cl.14 no.113 no.297 (from Arachne edition)

bibl.title: Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, additis graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae inscriptionibus

bibl.title: Siciliae et objacentium insularum veterum inscriptionum nova collectio prolegomenis et notis illustrata, et iterum cum emendationibus, & auctariis evulgata

bibl.title: Corpus Inscriptionum Graecarum
bibl.citation: A. Boeckh et al., Corpus Inscriptionum Graecarum, 4 vols (Berlin: Ex Officina Academica, 1828)
